Transaction Builder

Type: object

Build transactions

 No Additional Properties

root type
Type: const
Specific value: "buildTx"

root title

On-chain title of the transaction

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root title anyOf item 0
Type: string
root title anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)


Examples:

"NFT Minting Request"

"Pay 5 ADA to Charles"

root description

On-chain description of the transaction

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root description anyOf item 0
Type: string
root description anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

Examples:

"By running this transaction you will be minting your NFT"

"Hey Alice, this is Charles charging you for that pinapple pizza we had yesterday!"

root id

On-chain custom unique identifier of the transaction

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root id anyOf item 0
Type: string
root id anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

Examples:

"1679175913-342-323"

"e30d4b03fff054252310656fba33af29f5c29d"

"bob's payment #4"

"2023-03-18T21:45:13Z"

root tags

List or Key-Value Map of Tags, on-chain custom list of strings or keywords to identify transactions by categories

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tags anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tags anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tags anyOf Array item 1 items

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tags anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0
Type: string
root tags anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes

Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

Arguments:

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tags anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tags anyOf Numerical key map

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tags anyOf Numerical key map anyOf item 0
Type: string
root tags anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tags anyOf Alphanumerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tags anyOf Alphanumerical key map

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tags anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf item 0
Type: string
root tags anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root indexOf

On-chain custom index of the transaction within it's group

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root indexOf anyOf item 0
Type: number
root indexOf anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string

Example:

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

root group

On-chain custom group name where this transaction belongs

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root group anyOf item 0
Type: string

Type: string

set

  • path (string) - path of the value to set

  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Examples:

"GCFS Disk Update"

"Multisig Broadcast"

"NFT Drop"

root parentTxHash

On-chain custom transaction hash of a transaction considered parent of this one, or that this one is a reply to it

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root parentTxHash anyOf item 0
Type: string
root parentTxHash anyOf lang.json
Type: string

root onSuccessURL

DEPRECATED: On-chain custom on success redirection relative URL with transaction hash included as URL variable

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root onSuccessURL anyOf item 0

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

Example:

"/cart/success"

root onPendingURL

DEPRECATED: On-chain custom on pending redirection relative URL with transaction hash included as URL variable

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root onPendingURL anyOf item 0
Type: string
root onPendingURL anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

Example:

"/cart/pending"

  • Option 1

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Example:

"/cart/reject"

root returnURLPattern

On-chain custom redirection absolute URL template with transaction hash and/or other posible variables wrapped between { and }. Available templating variables are txHash

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root returnURLPattern anyOf item 0
Type: string
root returnURLPattern anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Examples:

"https://yourCustomDappSite.com/transaction/{txHash}/view"

"https://yourOtherCustomDappSite.com/cart.php?txHash={txHash}"

root config
Type: object

root config noLock

On-chain boolean value that when true will instruct GameChanger compatible wallets that load this transaction into local storage to avoid reserving UTXOs as inputs for it

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root config noLock anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root config noLock anyOf lang.json
Type: string

set

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root config agree

On-chain boolean value that when true will instruct GameChanger compatible wallets to require an extra confirmation to the user prior submitting this transaction

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root config agree anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root config agree anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root name
Type: string

Wallet stores locally specific objects for later reuse. This is the name property of this record. Names can collide.
Examples:

"Half signed transaction #4"

"Pay 5 ADA to Charles"

root tx

A Cardano transaction definition, with fields like inputs,outputs,mints,certificates,smartcontracts and metadata

  • Tx
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Tx
Type: object

A Cardano transaction definition, with fields like inputs,outputs,mints,certificates,smartcontracts and metadata

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction ttl
Type: object

Transaction validity interval in slots (1 second)

root tx anyOf Transaction ttl from

If set, is the absolute time in slots (1 second) since when the transaction will be valid.

  • Quantity
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction ttl from anyOf Quantity
Type: string

Quantity (Positive BigNum)
root tx anyOf Transaction ttl from anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction ttl duration

If set, is the duration in slots (1 second) from from since when the transaction will be valid. Cannot be used if until is used

  • Quantity
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction ttl duration anyOf Quantity
Type: string

Quantity (Positive BigNum)

Same definition as Quantity
root tx anyOf Transaction ttl duration anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

Arguments:

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.
