  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction ttl until

If set, is the absolute time in slots (1 second) after which the transaction will be no longer valid. Cannot be used if duration is used

  • Quantity
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction ttl until anyOf Quantity
Type: string

Quantity (Positive BigNum)

Same definition as Quantity
root tx anyOf Transaction ttl until anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string

  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value

  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

root tx anyOf Transaction inputs

List or Key-Value Map of TxInputRedeemable

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf lang.json
Type: string

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items

  • TxInputRedeemable
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf TxInputRedeemable
Type: object

Definition of a transaction input

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input txHash

  • TransactionHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input txHash anyOf TransactionHash
Type: string

Transaction Hash (hexadecimal)
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input txHash anyOf lang.json
Type: string

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input index

  • Index
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input index anyOf Index
Type: number

Index Number, representing a position of an item on a list. (Positive Integer, greater or equal than zero)
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input index anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input idPattern

User defined item ID. Will be used on buildTxs API to return an indexMap with final in-transaction indexes. On redeemable items it has to match the redeemer ID that will consume the item. Pattern can contain this placeholder variables:key, index (list index, not final in-transaction index), itemType (like 'output','spend','mint','cert','reward', etc..)

  • Item ID Pattern
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input idPattern anyOf Item ID Pattern
Type: string
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input idPattern anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

Examples:

"item_{itemType}_{key}"

"#{index}"

Type: string

  • value (any) - variable to store

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string

root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Numerical key map

  • TxInputRedeemable
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Numerical key map anyOf TxInputRedeemable
Type: object

Definition of a transaction input

Same definition as Transaction Input
root tx anyOf Transaction inputs anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs

List or Key-Value Map of TxInput

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Array item 1 items

  • TxInput
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf TxInput
Type: object

Definition of a transaction input

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input txHash

  • TransactionHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input txHash anyOf TransactionHash
Type: string

Transaction Hash (hexadecimal)

Same definition as Transaction Hash
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input txHash anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.

  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input index

  • Index
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input index anyOf Index
Type: number

Index Number, representing a position of an item on a list. (Positive Integer, greater or equal than zero)

Same definition as Index Number
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Input index anyOf lang.json
Type: string

root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Numerical key map

  • TxInput
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Numerical key map anyOf TxInput
Type: object

Definition of a transaction input

Same definition as Transaction Input
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Alphanumerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Alphanumerical key map

  • TxInput
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf TxInput
Type: object

Definition of a transaction input

Same definition as Transaction Input
root tx anyOf Transaction referenceInputs anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction collateral

List or Key-Value Map of Transaction Collateral Inputs

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tx anyOf Transaction collateral anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction collateral anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction collateral anyOf Array item 1 items

  • TxInput
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction collateral anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf TxInput
Type: object

Definition of a transaction input

Same definition as Transaction Input
root tx anyOf Transaction collateral anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf lang.json
Type: string

Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs

List or Key-Value Map of TxOutput

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items

  • TxOutput
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf TxOutput
Type: object

Definition of a transaction output

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output idPattern

User defined item ID. Will be used on buildTxs API to return an indexMap with final in-transaction indexes. On redeemable items it has to match the redeemer ID that will consume the item. Pattern can contain this placeholder variables:key, index (list index, not final in-transaction index), itemType (like 'output','spend','mint','cert','reward', etc..)

  • Item ID Pattern
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output idPattern anyOf Item ID Pattern
Type: string
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output idPattern anyOf lang.json
Type: string

set

"item_{itemType}_{key}"

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output address

Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items

  • Asset
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Asset
Type: object

  • Asset
  • Asset
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset
Type: object

Definition of a Cardano asset. Using an ASCII asset name encoding as argument

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset policyId

  • ScriptHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset policyId anyOf ScriptHash
Type: string

Native Script or Plutus Script (hexadecimal)
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset policyId anyOf lang.json
Type: string

set

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset quantity

  • Quantity
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset quantity anyOf Quantity
Type: string

Quantity (Positive BigNum)

Same definition as Quantity
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset quantity anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset assetName
Type: string
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset
Type: object

Definition of a Cardano asset. Using an hexadecimal asset name encoding as argument

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset policyId

  • ScriptHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset policyId anyOf ScriptHash
Type: string

Native Script or Plutus Script (hexadecimal)

Same definition as Native Script or Plutus Script Hash
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf item 0 oneOf Asset policyId anyOf lang.json
Type: string

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes

Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Numerical key map

  • Asset
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Numerical key map anyOf Asset
Type: object
Same definition as tx_anyOf_i0_outputs_anyOf_i1_items_anyOf_i0_assets_anyOf_i1_items_anyOf_i0
root tx anyOf Transaction outputs anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Output assets anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs
