GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Mint assets anyOf Alphanumerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Mint assets anyOf Alphanumerical key map

  • Asset
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Mint assets anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf Asset
Type: object
Same definition as tx_anyOf_i0_outputs_anyOf_i1_items_anyOf_i0_assets_anyOf_i1_items_anyOf_i0
root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Mint assets anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

  • value (string) - string to be truncated

  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Numerical key map

  • TxMint
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Numerical key map anyOf TxMint
Type: object

Definition of a transaction mint action, where native assets can be minted or burned

Same definition as Transaction Mint
root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Alphanumerical key map

No Additional Properties

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction mints anyOf Alphanumerical key map

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

Note: Use get to return the value later

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.

You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners

List or Key-Value Map of Transaction Required Signer. Among other reasons, when a transaction contains some features like Native or Plutus Scripts, is posible that it gets validated with many different verification key witnesses (signatures) combinations. To enforce a witness set or combination, you can include the verification key hashes in this list. Will use a feature in transaction's CBOR structure known as required_signers

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Array item 1 items

  • PublicKeyHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf PublicKeyHash
Type: string

Public Key Hash (hexadecimal)
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Numerical key map

  • PublicKeyHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Numerical key map anyOf PublicKeyHash
Type: string

Public Key Hash (hexadecimal)

Same definition as Public Key Hash
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Alphanumerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Alphanumerical key map

  • PublicKeyHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf PublicKeyHash
Type: string

Public Key Hash (hexadecimal)

Same definition as Public Key Hash
root tx anyOf Transaction requiredSigners anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners

List or Key-Value Map of Transaction Optional Signer. When a transaction contains some features like Native or Plutus Scripts, is posible that it gets validated with many different verification key witnesses (signatures) combinations. This won't alter the body, neither the transaction hash, but it affects de fee calculation. Without knowing the higgest amount posible of witnesses, fee will be lower than required and transaction validation will fail. This optionalSigners list is meant to contain the worst amount of verification key hashes posible. It will fill transaction's witness set CBOR structure with dummy witnesses to emulate the worst amount of bytes that can be used

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.

You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Array

root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Array item 1 items

  • PublicKeyHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf PublicKeyHash
Type: string

Public Key Hash (hexadecimal)

Same definition as Public Key Hash
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Numerical key map

  • PublicKeyHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Numerical key map anyOf PublicKeyHash
Type: string

Public Key Hash (hexadecimal)

Same definition as Public Key Hash
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Alphanumerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Alphanumerical key map

  • PublicKeyHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction optionalSigners anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf PublicKeyHash
Type: string

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.

You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

root tx anyOf Transaction certificates

set

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array item 1 items

  • TxCertificate
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf TxCertificate
Type: object

Definition of a transaction certificate

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Certificate idPattern

User defined item ID. Will be used on buildTxs API to return an indexMap with final in-transaction indexes. On redeemable items it has to match the redeemer ID that will consume the item. Pattern can contain this placeholder variables:key, index (list index, not final in-transaction index), itemType (like 'output','spend','mint','cert','reward', etc..)

  • Item ID Pattern
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Certificate idPattern anyOf Item ID Pattern
Type: string
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Certificate idPattern anyOf lang.json
Type: string

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

Examples:

"item_{itemType}_{key}"

"#{index}"

root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Certificate certHex

  • CertificateHex
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Certificate certHex anyOf CertificateHex
Type: string

Certificate in hexadecimal encoding
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Transaction Certificate certHex anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Numerical key map

  • TxCertificate
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Numerical key map anyOf TxCertificate
Type: object

Definition of a transaction certificate

Same definition as Transaction Certificate
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Alphanumerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Alphanumerical key map

  • TxCertificate
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf TxCertificate
Type: object

Definition of a transaction certificate

Same definition as Transaction Certificate
root tx anyOf Transaction certificates anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf lang.json
