GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses
Type: object
No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts

List or Key-Value Map of Native Script Witnesses

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf lang.json
Type: string

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)

This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Array item 1 items

  • NativeScriptHex
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf NativeScriptHex
Type: string

Native Script in hexadecimal encoding
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Numerical key map

  • NativeScriptHex
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Numerical key map anyOf NativeScriptHex
Type: string

Native Script in hexadecimal encoding

Same definition as Native Script (Hex)
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Alphanumerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Alphanumerical key map

  • NativeScriptHex
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf NativeScriptHex
Type: string

Native Script in hexadecimal encoding

Same definition as Native Script (Hex)
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses nativeScripts anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus

Plutus Smart Contract Witnesses, consisting on Script Sources and Consumers

  • PlutusBundle
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf PlutusBundle
Type: object

Plutus Bundle with properties required to interact with Smart Contracts.

No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts

List or Key-Value Map of Plutus Script Sources. Inlined or referenced (deployed) Plutus Scripts

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items

  • PlutusScriptSource
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf PlutusScriptSource
Type: object

Plutus Script Source definition

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source input

  • TxInput
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source input anyOf TxInput
Type: object

Definition of a transaction input

Same definition as Transaction Input
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source input anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source scriptHashHex

  • ScriptHash
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source scriptHashHex anyOf ScriptHash
Type: string

Native Script or Plutus Script (hexadecimal)

Same definition as Native Script or Plutus Script Hash
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source scriptHashHex anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source scriptHex

  • PlutusScriptHex
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source scriptHex anyOf PlutusScriptHex
Type: string

Plutus Script in hexadecimal encoding
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source scriptHex anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source lang

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source lang anyOf item 0
Type: enum (of string)

Must be one of:

  • "plutus_v1"
  • "plutus_v2"
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Script Source lang anyOf lang.json
Type: string

set

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.

You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string

You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Numerical key map

  • PlutusScriptSource
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Numerical key map anyOf PlutusScriptSource
Type: object

Plutus Script Source definition

Same definition as Plutus Script Source
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Alphanumerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Alphanumerical key map

  • PlutusScriptSource
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf PlutusScriptSource
Type: object

Plutus Script Source definition

Same definition as Plutus Script Source
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle scripts anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers

List or Key-Value Map of Plutus Consumers. Redeemers and Inlined or referenced Datums

  • lang.json
  • Array
  • Numerical key map
  • Alphanumerical key map
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array
Type: array

Must contain a minimum of 1 items

Each item of this array must be:

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items

  • PlutusConsumer
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf PlutusConsumer
Type: object

Plutus Consumer definition. This parameters are aditional information supplied that the node will use to validate the execution of the Plutus Validator (smart contract). There are no strict mandatory properties as some data can be inferred by GC automatically now or in the future, or you may want to freely combine it, but scriptHashHex is required if you provide a redeemer

No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer datum

  • PlutusDatumSource
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer datum anyOf PlutusDatumSource
Type: object

Plutus Datum Source definition

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer datum anyOf Plutus Datum Source input

  • TxInput
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer datum anyOf Plutus Datum Source input anyOf TxInput
Type: object

Definition of a transaction input

Same definition as Transaction Input
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer datum anyOf Plutus Datum Source input anyOf lang.json
Type: string

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer datum anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer

  • PlutusRedeemer
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer anyOf PlutusRedeemer
Type: object

Plutus Redeemer definition

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer anyOf Plutus Redeemer itemIdPattern
Default: "{itemType}:{key}"

The matching user defined item ID that will be consumed by this redeemer. The same ID has to match the transaction item ID that this redeemer will try to consume. Pattern can contain this placeholder variables:key, index (list index, not in-transaction redeemable item index), itemType ('spend','mint','cert' or 'reward')

  • Redeemable ID Pattern
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer anyOf Plutus Redeemer itemIdPattern anyOf Redeemable ID Pattern
Type: string
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer anyOf Plutus Redeemer itemIdPattern anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

Examples:

"item_{itemType}_{key}"

"#{index}"

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer anyOf Plutus Redeemer type

  • PlutusRedeemerType
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer anyOf Plutus Redeemer type anyOf PlutusRedeemerType
Type: enum (of string)

Plutus Redeemer Type

Must be one of:

  • "spend"
  • "mint"
  • "cert"
  • "reward"

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string
