  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer anyOf Plutus Redeemer stepsExUnits

  • BigNumber
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer anyOf Plutus Redeemer stepsExUnits anyOf BigNumber
Type: string

Big Number (BigNum)

Same definition as Big Number
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Array item 1 items anyOf Plutus Consumer redeemer anyOf Plutus Redeemer stepsExUnits anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Type: string

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Numerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Numerical key map

  • PlutusConsumer
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Numerical key map anyOf PlutusConsumer
Type: object

Plutus Consumer definition. This parameters are aditional information supplied that the node will use to validate the execution of the Plutus Validator (smart contract). There are no strict mandatory properties as some data can be inferred by GC automatically now or in the future, or you may want to freely combine it, but scriptHashHex is required if you provide a redeemer

Same definition as Plutus Consumer
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Numerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Alphanumerical key map
Type: object
No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Alphanumerical key map

  • PlutusConsumer
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf PlutusConsumer
Type: object

Plutus Consumer definition. This parameters are aditional information supplied that the node will use to validate the execution of the Plutus Validator (smart contract). There are no strict mandatory properties as some data can be inferred by GC automatically now or in the future, or you may want to freely combine it, but scriptHashHex is required if you provide a redeemer

Same definition as Plutus Consumer
root tx anyOf Transaction witnesses plutus anyOf Plutus Bundle consumers anyOf Alphanumerical key map anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

root tx anyOf Transaction auxiliaryData

  • TxAuxiliaryData
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction auxiliaryData anyOf TxAuxiliaryData
Type: object

Definition of a transaction auxiliary data or metadata

 No Additional Properties

All properties whose name matches the following regular expression must respect the following conditions

Property name regular expression:
root tx anyOf Transaction auxiliaryData anyOf Transaction Auxiliary Data
Type: object
root tx anyOf Transaction auxiliaryData anyOf lang.json
Type: string

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options
Type: object
No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction options validFromNow

When true, it overrides ttl.from automatically with the current slot number from the node

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options validFromNow anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root tx anyOf Transaction options validFromNow anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

Arguments:

  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options coinSelection

  • None
  • Farmer
  • Nutcracker
  • Random
root tx anyOf Transaction options coinSelection oneOf None
Type: const

No automatic coin selection. User must provide inputs manually

Specific value: "NO"
root tx anyOf Transaction options coinSelection oneOf Farmer
Type: const

Deterministic. Chooses first the UTXOs with more ada and less native assets. It tries to avoid using UTXOs with assets as long as possible

Specific value: "FMR"
root tx anyOf Transaction options coinSelection oneOf Nutcracker
Type: const

Deterministic. Chooses first the UTXOs with more ada and MORE native assets. Tries to split asset bundles to keep the wallet with low asset concentration in the same utxo

Specific value: "NCR"
root tx anyOf Transaction options coinSelection oneOf Random
Type: const

Non deterministic. Ideal for scenarios where (when possible because current UTXO distribution) concurrency is needed. This is what is used in the testnet airdrop as well

Specific value: "RND"

root tx anyOf Transaction options changeOptimizer

  • None
  • Balanced
  • Service Wallet [1K UTXOS x 3ADA]
  • Populator [not recomended]
root tx anyOf Transaction options changeOptimizer oneOf None
Type: const

GC will not modify change outputs to improve UTXO setup

Specific value: "NO"
root tx anyOf Transaction options changeOptimizer oneOf Balanced
Type: const

tries to keep 50% pure ADA UTXOs and 50% of 'muggles'. 50 UTXOs max in total. Each change output produced will have an ada value that will grow exponentially from the previous one

Specific value: "BAL"
root tx anyOf Transaction options changeOptimizer oneOf Service Wallet [1K UTXOS x 3ADA]
Type: const

creates 1000 UTXOs max, trying to keep 3 ada on each. Ideal for dapps so they can have more available unlocked UTXOs, which is useful for making concurrent transactions.

Specific value: "SVC-XS"
root tx anyOf Transaction options changeOptimizer oneOf Populator [not recomended]
Type: const

similar to the Service Wallet but parametrized by GC. It's what we are currently using for the testnet airdrop feature.It's not recomended because we may change parameters in the future.

Specific value: "POP"

root tx anyOf Transaction options collateralCoinSelection

  • None
  • Less Assets Less Ada
root tx anyOf Transaction options collateralCoinSelection oneOf None
Type: const

No automatic collateral coin selection. User must provide inputs manually

Specific value: "NO"
root tx anyOf Transaction options collateralCoinSelection oneOf Less Assets Less Ada
Type: const

Deterministic. Chooses first the UTXOs with less native assets and less ada. It tries to avoid using UTXOs with assets and with big amounts of ada as long as possible for low risk collateral selection

Specific value: "LASLAD"

root tx anyOf Transaction options setCollateralCoin

  • Quantity
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options setCollateralCoin anyOf Quantity
Type: string

Quantity (Positive BigNum)

Same definition as Quantity
root tx anyOf Transaction options setCollateralCoin anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options addOptionalSigners

Add addOptionalSigners number of dummy witnesses as placeholders to account for bytes and therefore fees for extra amount of posible signers. Sometimes the list of posible valid signers of a transaction can be variable, like with native or plutus scripts. You can set this number to the biggest amount of signers needed to successfully validate a transaction. You can also enumerate some optionalSigners manually, this option instead creates random key hashes and witnesses automatically

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options addOptionalSigners anyOf item 0
Type: number

Value must be greater or equal to 0

root tx anyOf Transaction options addOptionalSigners anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoOptionalSigners

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoOptionalSigners anyOf item 0
Type: object

Automatically detect the list of signers keys required for each feature and add dummy witnesses for all of them (placeholders to account for bytes and therefore fees). In some cases such as nativeScript the detected signers can be all the posible signers used inside the script, without taking any actual script execution into account

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoOptionalSigners anyOf item 0 nativeScript

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoOptionalSigners anyOf item 0 nativeScript anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoOptionalSigners anyOf item 0 nativeScript anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0
Type: object

Automatically detect the list of signers keys required for each feature and add them to the required_signers field of the transaction to explicitely make them mandatory. In some cases such as nativeScript the detected signers can be all the posible signers used inside the script, without taking any actual script execution into account

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 input

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 input anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 input anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 collateral anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 collateral anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 nativeScript

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 nativeScript anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 nativeScript anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 certs

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 certs anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoRequireSigners anyOf item 0 certs anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Otherwise, it returns the original string

Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace

  • value (string) - value to replaced with

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoProvision

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoProvision anyOf item 0
Type: object

When some elements on a transaction are missing, but can be found elsewhere, for example on a user's Workspace, this plugins can insert them automatically when set to true.

 No Additional Properties

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoProvision anyOf item 0 workspaceNativeScript

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoProvision anyOf item 0 workspaceNativeScript anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoProvision anyOf item 0 workspaceNativeScript anyOf lang.json
Type: string

GCScript Inline Scripting Language

Inline scripting language function definitions

set

The function set allows you to set arbitrary data on script context for later reuse.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to set
  • value (any) - variable to store

Note: Use get to return the value later

get

The function get allows you to get arbitrary data from script context.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path of the value to retrieve

Note: Use set to set this values in first place

getArray

Returns an array with each provided argument as an item

Arguments:

  • values (any) - items of the array separated by comma

console

Dumps to console a message (or object)

Arguments:

  • type ('log'|'info'|'warn'|'error') - value to pretty print in the logs
  • value (any) - value to pretty print in the logs

jsonToObj

Parses a JSON string and returns an object

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string value to parse, must be a valid JSON string

objToJson

Turns an object into a valid JSON string

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

strToHex

Encodes a utf-8 text string into hexadecimal string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

hexToStr

Decodes an hexadecimal string into the former utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - hexadecimal encoded string

strToBase64

Encodes a utf-8 text string into base64 string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - utf-8 text string

base64ToStr

Decodes a base64 string into a utf-8 text string

Arguments:

  • value (string) - base64 encoded string

strToMetadataStr

Automatically splits a utf-8 text string into a list of 64 bytes long strings if value length is bigger than 64 bytes
Otherwise, it returns the original string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be adapted for metadata usage

metadataStrToStr

If a list of strings ( produced by strToMetadataStr ) is provided, joins it into a single string
If a string is provided, returns the string

Strings in transaction's auxiliary data (metadata) can't be longer than 64 bytes.
Many standards use a list of short strings as a workaround.
You can use strToMetadataStr and metadataStrToStr to work with metadata strings.

Arguments:

  • value (string | [string]) - string or list of strings produced by strToMetadataStr

truncate

Truncates a string from start to prefixLength characters, attaches a separator string, and finally adds the last suffixLength characters of the string
Usefull for truncating long texts, or hashes and addresses when you want to keep the beginning and the end of them and discard the middle.

Example:

addr1qzk45...gkwg (prefixLength=10 ,suffixLength=4, separator="...")

Arguments:

  • value (string) - string to be truncated
  • prefixLength (number) - initial number of characters to be included in resulting string
  • suffixLength (number) - final number of charactes to be included in resulting string
  • separator (string) - string to be included between prefix and suffix parts of the string

replaceAll

Replaces all match ocurrencies inside str by value

Arguments:

  • str (string) - string where to search and replace
  • match (string) - exact string that will be searched for and replaced by value
  • value (string) - value to replaced with

delay

Pauses the execution for interval milliseconds

Arguments:

  • value (any) - object to serialize as a JSON string

getAddressInfo

Get address information as an object with many usefull properties

Arguments:

  • address (string) - a valid cardano address

sha512

Calculates SHA512 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha256

Calculates SHA256 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

sha1

Calculates SHA1 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

md5

Calculates MD5 hash of data string

Arguments:

  • data (string) - arbitrary string to be hashed

uuid

Generates a random RFC4122 UUID v4

Arguments:

addBigNum

Adds extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the sum as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - addends separated by comma (BigNum)

subBigNum

Substracts extraArgs subtrahends numbers from an initial value minuend. Fails on underflow.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the substraction as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - minuend, initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - subtrahends separated by comma (BigNum)

mulBigNum

Multiplies extraArgs numbers to an initial value.

BigNum are big positive integers provided as strings.
This function also convert numbers on arguments into BigNum string

Returns the multiplication as a BigNum string.

Arguments:

  • value (string | number) - initial value (BigNum)
  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options autoProvision anyOf item 0 workspacePlutusScript

  • Option 1
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoProvision anyOf item 0 workspacePlutusScript anyOf item 0
Type: boolean
root tx anyOf Transaction options autoProvision anyOf item 0 workspacePlutusScript anyOf lang.json
Type: string

  • extraArgs ([string | number]) - Multipliers separated by comma (BigNum)

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

root tx anyOf Transaction options defaultIdPattern
Default: "{itemType}:{key}"

When not individually set, each user defined transaction item will be asigned with an ID generated based on this pattern. IDs will be used on buildTxs API to return an indexMap with final in-transaction indexes. On redeemable items it has to match the redeemer ID that will consume the item. Pattern can contain this placeholder variables:key, index (list index, not final in-transaction index), itemType (like 'output','spend','mint','cert','reward', etc..)

  • Default Item ID Pattern
  • lang.json
root tx anyOf Transaction options defaultIdPattern anyOf Default Item ID Pattern
Type: string
root tx anyOf Transaction options defaultIdPattern anyOf lang.json
Type: string

set

Same definition as GCScript Inline Scripting

Examples:

"item_{itemType}_{key}"

"#{index}"
root tx anyOf lang.json
Type: string
